statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Write a program to read in a list of integers and determine whether or not each number is prime. A number, n, is prime if its only divisors are 1 and n. For this problem, the numbers 1 and 2 are not considered primes.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: Each input line contains a single integer. The list of integers is terminated with a number<= 0. You may assume that the input contains at most 250 numbers and each number is less than or equal to 16000.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: The output should consists of one line for every number, where each line first lists the problem number, followed by a colon and space, followed by "yes" or "no".

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
1: no
2: no
3: yes
4: no
5: yes
6: yes

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2008 “Sunline Cup” National Invitational Contest - Warm Up
